intro: Sauroglossum dromadum, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has a succulent stem and leaves that are adapted to store water, enabling it to thrive in dry environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological adaptations, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and botanical gardens.
